parameters.name: All
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to remove all tags from the specified resource. Valid values:

*   **true**: removes all tags from the specified resource.
*   **false**: does not remove all tags from the specified resource. This is the default value.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

You can use the client to generate the value, but you must make sure that it is unique among different requests. The client token can contain only ASCII characters.

>  If you do not set this parameter, the system automatically uses the value of **RequestId** as the value of **ClientToken**. The value of **RequestId** is different for each API request.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to perform a dry run. Valid values:

*   **true**: performs a dry run. The system checks the required parameters, request syntax, and limits. If the request fails the dry run, an error message is returned. If the request passes the dry run, the `DryRunOperation` error code is returned.
*   **false**: performs a dry run and sends the request. If the request passes the dry run, a 2xx HTTP status code is returned and the operation is performed. This is the default value.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the resource.

You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~443657~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: ResourceId
parameters.description: The ID of the resource. You can specify up to 50 resource IDs in each call.

parameters.name: ResourceType
parameters.description:
The type of the resource from which you want to remove tags. Valid values:

*   **loadbalancer**: a Network Load Balancer (NLB) instance
*   **securitypolicy**: a security policy
*   **servergroup**: a server group

parameters.name: TagKey
parameters.description: The key of the tag that you want to remove. You can remove up to 20 tags in each call.
